abstract: Lloyd C. Blankfein, chief executive of Goldman Sachs, argued Tuesday that his bank was easier to manage than its bigger rivals, and he defended Goldman against proposals to break up the biggest banks.
snippet: Lloyd C. Blankfein, chief executive of Goldman Sachs, argued Tuesday that his bank was easier to manage than its bigger rivals, and he defended Goldman against proposals to break up the biggest banks.
lead_paragraph: Lloyd C. Blankfein, chief executive of Goldman Sachs, argued Tuesday that his bank was easier to manage than its bigger rivals, and he defended Goldman against proposals to break up the biggest banks.

headline.main: Blankfein Says Goldman Is ‘Simpler’ Than Rivals
